instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the inversion results on soil salinity detection in the Keriya Oasis?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the inversion results in this study is the coefficient of determination (R-2). R-2 measures the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable (soil salinity in this case) that can be explained by the independent variables (PALSAR-2 data, Landsat 8 data, evapotranspiration data, groundwater burial depth data, and DEM data).

instruction: What is the purpose of using the PSO-SVR and PSO-BPNN models in the study on soil salinity detection in the Keriya Oasis?
Output: The purpose of using the PSO-SVR and PSO-BPNN models in the study on soil salinity detection in the Keriya Oasis is to improve the accuracy of soil salinity inversion. The PSO algorithm, when combined with support vector machine regression (SVR) and back-propagation neural network (BPNN) models, enhances the estimation performance of the models. By introducing PSO, the accuracy (R-2) of the SVR and BPNN models improved when using PALSAR-2 data, Landsat 8 data, and the combination of PALSAR-2 and Landsat 8 data. The PSO-SVR model, in particular, achieved better inversion results when combined with PALSAR + Landsat data. Therefore, the purpose of using the PSO-SVR and PSO-BPNN models is to enhance the accuracy of soil salinity detection in the Keriya Oasis using multi-source remote sensing data.

instruction: Can the introduction of the PSO algorithm improve the estimating performance of the SVR and BPNN models for soil salinity inversion using PALSAR-2 data, Landsat 8 data, evapotranspiration data, groundwater burial depth data, and DEM data in the Keriya Oasis?
Output: Yes, the introduction of the PSO algorithm can improve the estimating performance of the SVR and BPNN models for soil salinity inversion using PALSAR-2 data, Landsat 8 data, evapotranspiration data, groundwater burial depth data, and DEM data in the Keriya Oasis. The results of the study showed that the SVR model accuracy (R-2) improved by 0.07 (PALSAR-2 data), 0.20 (Landsat 8 data), and 0.19 (PALSAR + Landsat data) when combined with the PSO algorithm. Similarly, the BPNN model accuracy (R-2) improved by 0.03 (PALSAR-2 data), 0.24 (Landsat 8 data), and 0.12 (PALSAR + Landsat data) when combined with the PSO algorithm. Therefore, the introduction of the PSO algorithm enhanced the performance of both models in estimating soil salinity inversion in the Keriya Oasis.
